greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of alpha, the unique solution on [2,oo) of the equation alpha*log((2*e)/alpha)=1.
comment: alpha is used to measure the expected height of random binary search trees.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 5.13 Binary search tree constants, p. 352.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Luc Devroye, A note on the height of binary search trees, Journal of the ACM, Vol. 33, No. 3 (1986), pp. 489-498.
Bruce Reed, The height of a random binary search tree, J. ACM, 50 (2003), 306-332.
John Michael Robson, The height of binary search trees, Australian Computer Journal, Vol. 11, No. 4 (1979), pp. 151-153.
Larry Shepp, Doron Zeilberger and Cun-Hui Zhang, Pick up sticks, arXiv preprint arXiv:1210.5642 [math.CO] (2012).
Index entries for sequences related to rooted trees
Index entries for sequences related to trees
formula: alpha = -1/W(-exp(-1)/2), where W is the Lambert W function.
A195582(n)/A195583(n) = alpha*log(n) - beta*log(log(n)) + O(1), with beta = 1.953... (A195599).
xref: Cf. A195597 (continued fraction), A195598 (Engel expansion), A195581, A195582, A195583, A195599, A195600, A195601.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 21 2011
